==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
[[File:Daifuku_1.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|餡餅}} (''anmochi''): a pair of [[daifuku]], a kind of '''[[anmochi]]'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=j|あん|もち}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=あんもち|餡|tr1=an|t1=sweet azuki bean paste|餅|tr2=mochi|t2=mochi, pounded sweet-rice dough}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=j|あんもち|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR|acc3=3|acc3_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
{{ja-l|あん餅}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|あんもち}}

# [[anmochi]]: [[mochi]] (a dough made from pounded sweet rice) [[stuffed]] with [[anko]] (sweet red bean paste)

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-l|大福|だいふく}}, {{ja-l|大福餅|だいふく もち}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|あん|も}}
A [[baby talk|baby-talk]] contraction of ''anmochi'' above.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|あんも}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|あんも}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=あんも|childish}} [[anmochi]]: [[mochi]] (a dough made from pounded sweet rice) [[stuffed]] with [[anko]] (sweet red bean paste)
